The service was friendly and helpful, the prices moderate, and the selection superior.  Everyone gives it five stars, but based on the three flavors we ate, Amore does not deserve it.  The problem is the gelato itself, specifically the flavors.  The tartufo gelato was entirely bland -- no flavor at all.  Ditto the combined nutella and white chocolate, which was also astonishingly sweet.  The whiskey gelato was the best of the lot.  I am tempted to return to try some more flavors because this is a place you really want to love. Maybe someday.

A sweet little Italian place that shouldn't have been difficult to find but turned out to be an adventure.  If you're on your smart phone, don't auto click for directions.  Copy and input the address to your map app. to find this place.  Trust me, you don't want to be doing a tour of the timeshare homes of Arizona.     Lots of varieties of creamy gelatos; perfect for an after meal dessert.  The fruit gelatos were sweet and refreshing - they certainly have a wide range of fruity flavors for you to choose from.  The chocolates and dessert based gelatos are heavier on the tongue and would go lovely with a smokey cup of espresso, which they serve right in the shop.  Definitely give this place a try if you're in the area.

Has to be one of the best gelato places out there. They also have great sandwiches and coffee - very smooth coffee. My sons favorite is the pumpkin gelato which is only out seasonally so go soon. Staff are very Italian which says it all

That's Amore Gelato is by far the best Gelato in Arizona. If you come here in the evenings there is a line but it's so well worth the wait.  The entire staff is extremely friendly and helpful! You get to sample 2 flavors, usually the first one you try, is the one you buy, that's how good this gelato is.  Wonderful flavors, great ambiance, and super friendly service. Homemade (made in-house) - flavors like biscotto, banana, chocolates of all sorts, too many to list. There are so many unique and creative flavors to try. I can't name one that is my favorite, I've tried about all of them and they are all so good.  If you're up in the area or not, trust me, That's Amore Gelato IS THE place for true gelato in Phoenix.

I find it amusing that a place with such good yelp reviews needs to resort to bot voting to try to win the best of azcentral's best ice cream poll. Good gelato but I'll knock off two stars to the owners who have to use trickery to try to influence people. I wonder how many of their 5 star yelp reviews are phony also.

Eccelente! I am constantly on the look out for Italian gente, and as soon as we walked into That's Amore, I knew I had found some.   It was late and a little girl was in the window. She told me her favorites: nocciola, amaretto, e stratacella - a woman of traditional tastes. Her father was cleaning up, and clearly ready to close, but he graciously served us. We shared short Italian banter - his daughter is clearly the talker in the family, and she loves to entertain.   Their selection of gelati is extensive. I have enough trouble choosing amongst 12 flavors, so this was just clearly going to be the biggest challenge of my night. I went with the little girl's faves - nocciola e amaretto. Delizioso. My date went for fruit - chocolate coconut and raspberry (lampone). Also excellent. The flavors are rich and the gelato creamy. Their store is fairly large and bright. Their display case is huge and its contents induce immediate salivation.  Two brothers and their wives run two locations. They are local, traditional, and a very nice family. I will definitely make the drive out to see them again. I love good gelato.
Best gelato I've ever had, including in Italy

I will keep this short and sweet.  This place is dope. If you are in the mood for gelato or ice cream or anything cold and yummy and live in the north scottsdale area this place is an absolute must.  Can't recommend this place enough!

We just happened to stumble upon this place one day while driving around. I had a mix of dolce latte with creme bule and it was amazing! It kind of caught me off guard. Will absolutely most definitely come back the next time I feel like gelato.

Best gelato ever, so happy my in laws showed me this gem. They have so many flavors and they are all delicious. Very authentic place. My favorite flavor is the tiramisu and the cannolo. Can't wait to go back.

So many flavors. So delicious. I had the whisky cream and coffee in medium sized waffle cone. My husband ordered a pistachio in a small waffle cone. He loved it and I loved it. This place is simply delicious. I definitely will come back again.

Best gelato ever. Ive been coming here for years and have always had the best experience. The atmosphere is like Italy and the employees are outgoing and funny. All of the gelato flavors are to die for. The portion sizing is perfect the quality is out of this world. Best gelato I've had my whole life. There are so many flavors to choose from. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for great desserts or gelato. A+++++
Good Gelato, variety of flavors, great service, busy on a Saturday evening after dinner. It was a little pricey.
Possibly one of the best gelato places in the US. I had gelato in different places in Italy and this place is not any less than any of them. There are so many flavors to choose from.
Gelato is delicious. Lots of selections to choose from. A taste of Italy right here in Scottsdale!
Amazing!!  They have every flavor of gelato you could want. Very reasonably priced. Great place to go after dinner. I haven't tried the pastries, but they look amazing.
Hands down, the best gelato I've ever had.  Better than Rome! Worth every penny. Also helped that it was served up by a very hunky Italian guy.
Great spot for some awesome gelato. Lovely owners who know the ropes.  Love this place!  You will too!  Try it!
The best gelato EVER.  Flavors taste natural and fresh.  Huge variety.  I have been  in Scottsdale one week and visited three times.
Are you kidding me!!!! This place is just the best...hands down...every single time we come it's just amazing. Check out the pic!!! 9pm and this place is packed and had a line out the door!!!
Love this place in N Scottsdale. Great selection of options. The owner is very friendly & welcoming and really let's you try different options before you order. Highly recommend this place.

Found this place on Yelp so we stopped by after dinner for some coffee. Well we walked in and saw the rows of gelato and couldn't resist! Got the stracciatella and creme brulee and both were yummy. Not cloyingly sweet and very smooth, it was delicious. Also got a cappuccino which was alright, but I'd like to try the cae mocha next time. We'll be back if we're every in the area!

OH WOW!!! THIS IS THE REAL DEAL!  I was able to speak to the owners in my broken Italian-- it was awesome.   Then he had a SPECIAL gelato made for me... you ready for this?  Pepperoni Gelato--- ha!  He did it as a funny and it was really cute.  Anyhow, next time I am further up north, I am stopping by again!   DE-LISH!

We all came in and tried different flavors. There are so many flavors to choose from I will have to come back for months to try. The gelato is creamy and the flavor is delicious. We all agreed that until we find someplace better, this will be our new favorite place to come for dessert. Once you try it, you won't forget.

This gelato shop does live up to its standards. They have a nice mural on the wall to represent America and Italy. Great selection of gelato. I had the dark chocolate sorbet and my girlfriend had the tiramisu. Both were really good. Nice area to be around as well.

I love walking into this place. Not only do they have an AMAZING dolce de leche gelato (my favorite) but the owners are hardcore Italians with a passion for their gelato. It's run and operated by two Italian brothers and their wives, and they always seem to appreciate my feeble attempts at conversing in Italian, haha! This is truly the hidden gem of all Arizona gelato, you can by far taste the difference from any other "authentic gelato posers." This is worth the splurge for an after dinner treat...or before dinner ;-) Along with dolce de leche, the chocolate coconut and the spicy chocolate are ones to test out as well. You feel like every bite you take here is fresh like it's been made that morning.  The best part is even a small gives you enough to leave you satisfied. In order to be a true gelato connoisseur (as well as save a few calories) eat it slow...it's worth the time to savor at this place!

The most fabulous gelato I've had - EVER! Such a darling couple who scratch makes everything they sell. There is a dizzying array of gelato flavors and sweet little pastries. We can't wait to go back!!

Every bit deserving of the solid 5 stars. Unbelievable variety of gelato with friendly service.  We tried the rum chocolate and whiskey cream. Both were outstanding! There is a flavor for everyone here. We look forward to many return visits.

This is my favorite gelato place ever!  The flavors are rich and so original.  I always sample a few and then end up with the same thing every time which is mango and toblerone. There's always a constant flow of customers, and I love the Italian feel.  Real gelato, real Italians, REAL good

I come here frequently with a gentleman that I assist.  I have NEVER had a bad scoop of gelato - are there some flavors I like better than others - yes but across the board everything is top quality.  Owners and employees are helpful and friendly.  I didn't realize they had a loyalty card until much later (because I didn't pay attention to the sign) so if you visit often make sure to ask for one.   Best gelato in SDL !!

Average quality gelato, and sometimes even artificial tasting or hypersweet. I recommend Paris Gourmet - a new place that also makes macarons. Less flavors though.  We come from the OC where they have Vitaly, the best gelato, so we know our cold desserts.

This place probably doesn't need my 5 star review as it has received multiple rewards and write-ups already detailing how great their gelato is and how sweet the owners are. So, let me just say that it really is wonderful, the biscotto is my favorite flavor, and having an espresso here always reminds me of being in Italy.

Oh my goodness, That's Amore Gelato! I am in love. We stopped in today to get some dessert. My husband tried this pastry called sfogliatelle, which looked like a shell and had ricotta cheese inside. It was very dense but he loved the taste. It was really crunchy on the outside, but the filling was nice and soft. Not too sweet or creamy; just right. I had their tiramisu and it was really yummy; definitely tasted the rum. Also had a pint of gelato to go. It probably took us like 10 minutes to decide on the flavor as they have so many flavors to choose from. We were able to choose 3 flavors to fill our pint for around $10. They really pack it in to fill every space in the container though. Came home and tried the 3 flavors - vanilla, mint chocolate and mascarpone. It was so good, I wanted to throw away the Haagen Dazs ice cream in my freezer.  I can't wait to go back and try all the other flavors.
First time trying this place and it was great!! Unique flavors and friendly staff. Will definitely come here again.

It's stupid how good this gelato is.  The guy behind the counter recommended the black cherry as his favorite, which was spectacular.  Girlfriend loved the Creme Brûlée.  After reading a newspaper post on the wall here that the owners were all Italians, I had to try the espresso.  All delicious.

We are in love with the gelato at That's Amore! I had the chocolate and tartufo flavors; both delicious. Overall, we are happy to support a small business such as this one that has good food and great service :)
Heaven! The Italian owners have a lot of heart & soul and it shows in there delicious gelato.

best gelato ever, hands down. i try new flavors every time and i love mixing different flavors and i've loved everything i've tried!! it's almost always super crowded but i've never had to wait long and they take care of everyone really quickly which is awesome! if you like gelato, definitely give this place a try!

Gelato Store in North Scottsdale serving Gelato and pastries including Canolis.  Tried the Pistachio and Strasitella, I believe she must of been one of the owners.  We came in on a warm 105 degree day after Golf Lessons at Troon North around 5 pm, so something cold seemed the appropriate thing.  The Pistachio was good and the Strasitella was good but did not seem quite as cold as expected.   The only other Gelato shop I have been to seemed to be what I am most used to and the comparison for this one did not live up to what I had have before.
Our new favorite gelato stop.  Many choices - hard to decide.  Pastries as well and it appears that they also make sandwiches.  We will certainly be back many times in the future.

I must concede, the gelato is really great. The black cherry is my favorite, it tastes just like the old frozen treats called "screwball" when I was a kid. However, the customer service is atrocious. WARNING: do not mix vanilla with more complicated flavors because you will get 95% vanilla and a little spoonful of something yummy. I have a whole nother issue with how they refused to give me a punch card when I deserved one for buying two meals separately... They only wanted to give me one. On top of this, I understand Italian and I overheard them speaking in a very derogatory manner towards two nice older ladies who were completely oblivious.
